alert.note: Alert for Covington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 8:47PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following county, Covington. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms producing very heavy rain in the advisory. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have quickly fallen during the past hour in some areas. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of creeks, streams, local roadways, and low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Andalusia, Opp, Stanley, Sanford, Horn Hill, Babbie, Red Oak, Onycha, Green Bay, Wiggins, Carolina, Beulah, Blairs, Estothel and County Line. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
